turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about History of serfdom.
turn.1: What was the legal basis for serfdom?
turn.2: The edict applied to all peasants whose holdings were above a certain size, and included both Crown lands and noble estates.
turn.3: What were the main elements of the legal basis?
turn.4: The peasants were freed from the obligation of personal services to the lord and annual dues; in return landowners were given ownership of 1/3 to 1/2 of the land.
turn.6: The peasant owned and rented the lands that were deeded to the old owners.
turn.7: Did most people live in rural areas?
turn.8: The other German states imitated Prussia after 1815.
turn.9: What is the most important fact in the history of serfdom?
turn.10: In sharp contrast to the violence that characterized land reform in the French Revolution, Germany handled it peacefully.
turn.11: Did most people like this system?
turn.12: In Schleswig the peasants, who had been influenced by the Enlightenment, played an active role; elsewhere they were largely passive.
